alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory continues tonight.

What:
Total snowfall amounts near 10 cm. 
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Continues tonight.

Additional information:
Snow associated with a passing weather system is affecting portions of northwestern Ontario. Snow will taper to flurries from west to east overnight.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Beginning tonight and tapering Monday evening.

Discussion:
Areas east of Lake Superior will see closer to 10 cm of snow and areas northeast of Georgian Bay will see closer to 15 cm of snow.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Continuing through Monday morning.

Discussion:
Snow associated with a passing weather system will continue and intensify tonight. Conditions should gradually improve Monday morning and snow tapers to light flurries.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory continues overnight.

What:
Total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm. Higher local amounts are possible.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Continuing through overnight.

Additional information:
Snow will taper off from west to east early this morning. It is possible that some areas will receive in excess of 15 cm.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.description:

What:

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Snow continues this morning.

What:
Additional local snowfall amounts of 2 to 4 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Continuing through early this morning.

Additional information:
Snow will taper off to light flurries later this morning.

###

Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Lake effect snow begins this afternoon.

What:
Local snowfall amounts of near 10 cm.
Reduced visibility due to heavy snow.

When:
Beginning this afternoon into early Tuesday morning.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Strong wind gusts today.

What:
Wind gusts up to 80 km/h possible.

When:
This afternoon.

Additional information:
Strong southwesterly winds will develop this afternoon, weakening by early this evening.

High winds may toss loose objects, cause tree branches to break.
Local power outages may be possible.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
